body_html:
Let me see if I understand correctly. In the True branch, I create a queue and define a QueueRunner object (which is stored and referenced later). This QueueRunner is then started by the tf.train.Supervisor() before starting the main training loop. Does this started QueueRunner then violate the assumption that the cond() branch is only a function?

On another note, If I manipulate the condition to always evaluate to the "True" branch (which involves the queueing operations), the error still arises.

body:
Let me see if I understand correctly. In the True branch, I create a queue and define a QueueRunner object (which is stored and referenced later). This QueueRunner is then started by the tf.train.Supervisor() before starting the main training loop. Does this started QueueRunner then violate the assumption that the cond() branch is only a function? 

On another note, If I manipulate the condition to always evaluate to the "True" branch (which involves the queueing operations), the error still arises.
